text: Antonio Carluccio, OBE OMRI ( 19 April 1937 â€“ 8 November 2017) was an Italian chef, restaurateur and food expert. He was born in Vietri sul Mare, Salerno, Italy. Carluccio has been called "the godfather of Italian gastronomy", with a career of more than 50 years. He was best known for his television appearances, including his partnership with fellow Italian chef Gennaro Contaldo, and their BBC Two television series Two Greedy Italians. He wrote many books about cooking. Carluccio died on 8 November 2017 from complications of a fall in London at the age of 80. ==References== ==Other websites== *Antonio Carluccio's official website *Antonio Carluccio on life *give up" Antonio Carluccio *Carluccio's Caffes' website Category:1937 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Accidental deaths in the United Kingdom Category:Italian chefs Category:20th-century Italian writers Category:Restaurateurs Category:Italian television personalities
